Container.Name: ownCloud-OCIS
Container.Overview:
ownCloud Infinite Scale (OCIS) is the next-generation file sync and share platform. A complete rewrite of ownCloud built with Go, it's faster, more secure, and designed for modern cloud infrastructure.
**Key Features:** - Modern, microservices-based architecture - Built-in office document collaboration - API-first design with extensive extensibility - Advanced security and compliance features - Kubernetes-native and cloud-ready
**Default Credentials:** - Username: admin - Password: admin (change immediately!)
**Security Notes:** - Default JWT secrets are provided for initial setup - **IMPORTANT**: Change all security tokens for production use - Generate new secrets using: `openssl rand -base64 32`
**Important Notes:** - This is the basic OCIS setup. For production use with SSL/TLS, consider the full deployment with Traefik reverse proxy - OCIS_INSECURE is enabled for local network access - For external access, you'll need proper domain configuration and SSL certificates - If OCIS_URL is not set to your server's IP or domain, you may face issues logging in or starting up.

Config.Name: Web UI
Config.Description: Web interface port for ownCloud OCIS

Config.Name: Data Director
Config.Description: Directory where OCIS stores user data, metadata, and internal files

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: Directory where OCIS stores configuration files

Config.Name: OCIS Domain
Config.Description: Primary domain for OCIS (e.g., ocis.yourdomain.com). Leave empty for IP-based access.

Config.Name: Admin Password
Config.Description: Custom admin password. Leave empty to use default 'admin' password.

Config.Name: Insecure Mode
Config.Description: Enable insecure mode for local network access without SSL. Set to 'false' for production with proper SSL setup.

Config.Name: Proxy HTTP Address
Config.Description: HTTP address for the proxy service to bind to. Use 0.0.0.0:9200 for all interfaces or specify IP:port.

Config.Name: OCIS URL
Config.Description: Full URL for OCIS access. Use https://your-server-ip:9200 or your domain. Keep https even with insecure mode.

Config.Name: JWT Secret
Config.Description: JWT secret for token signing. Leave empty to auto-generate a random secret. For production, use a secure random string.

Config.Name: Machine Auth API Key
Config.Description: Machine auth API key for internal service communication. Leave empty to auto-generate.

Config.Name: Web UI Theme
Config.Description: Custom theme server URL. Leave empty for default theme.

Config.Name: Demo Users
Config.Description: Create demo users (einstein, marie, richard, etc.) for testing. Set to 'true' to enable.

Config.Name: SMTP Host
Config.Description: SMTP server hostname for email notifications (optional)

Config.Name: SMTP Port
Config.Description: MTP server port (usually 587 for TLS or 465 for SSL)

Config.Name: SMTP Username
Config.Description: SMTP authentication username (optional)

Config.Name: SMTP Password
Config.Description: SMTP authentication password (optional)

Config.Name: SMTP Security
Config.Description: SMTP security method (none, starttls, ssl)

Config.Name: Max File Size
Config.Description: Maximum file upload size in bytes (default: 1GB)

Config.Name: PUID
Config.Description: UserID for file permissions (99 = nobody user in Unraid)

Config.Name: PGID
Config.Description: GroupID for file permissions (100 = users group in Unraid)

Config.Name: Log Level
Config.Description: Log level for OCIS (debug, info, warn, error)

Config.Name: SMTP Sender
Config.Description: Email address for sending notifications (e.g., 'ocis-noreply@yourdomain.com)

Config.Name: Transfer Secret
Config.Description: Transfer secret for secure file operations. Leave empty to auto-generate.
